summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, providing notice of the government's intent to call an expert witness, Dr. [REDACTED], a clinical psychologist specializing in trauma and sexual abuse. The letter details the expert's qualifications and expected testimony on topics like grooming, victim behavior, and disclosure patterns. It also includes a request for reciprocal discovery from the defense.

events.title: Government Expert Witness Disclosure
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office formally notifies Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team of its intent to call an expert witness, Dr. [REDACTED], at trial to testify about trauma psychology and patterns of sexual abuse.

events.title: Initial Government Discovery Request
events.description: The government had previously requested reciprocal discovery from the defense, a request which is reiterated in this letter.

locations: Alpert Medical School of Brown University
keyFacts: The government plans to call an expert witness, a clinical psychologist and trauma specialist, to testify about grooming, victim behavior, and the psychological impact of sexual abuse on minors.
The expert's testimony is intended to provide general context about abuse patterns and is explicitly stated as not being an evaluation of any specific victim in the Maxwell case.
The document is a formal legal notice required under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 16(a)(1)(G) regarding expert witnesses.
The government reiterates a request for reciprocal discovery from Maxwell's defense team, including any expert witnesses the defense intends to call.
The name and specific identifying details of the government's expert witness are redacted in this document.
